tn.ref: I will place his throne over these stones ... his pavilion over them
tn.text: Both the king's "throne" and "pavilion" are used to refer to his royal authority. AT: "I will cause him to rule as king over the people of Egypt. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Anyone who is assigned to death will be given to death
tn.text: AT: "Everyone will die whom I have decided must die" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Anyone who is assigned to captivity will be taken captive
tn.text: AT: "The Babylonians will take everyone captive whom I have decided must go into captivity" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: And anyone who is assigned to the sword will be given to the sword
tn.text: AT: "Everyone will die in battle whom I have decided will die in battle" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: He will clean out the land of Egypt just as shepherds clean vermin off their clothes
tn.text: "He will take everything valuable from Egypt just as a shepherd is careful to get every insect off of his clothes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
the name of a city, "Sun City" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
